source:
---
title: Dataset 164 - Units
format:
  html:
    toc: true
    number-sections: true
engine: julia
execute:
  freeze: auto
  cache: true

#| echo: false
#| output: false
using UFFReader

data.text/plain:
Universal Dataset Number: 164

  [1mName: Units[22m

  [36mRecord 1: FORMAT(I10,20A1,I10)[39m
  [36m            Field 1      -- units code[39m
  [36m                            = 1 - SI: Meter (newton)[39m
  [36m                            = 2 - BG: Foot (pound f)[39m
  [36m                            = 3 - MG: Meter (kilogram f)[39m
  [36m                            = 4 - BA: Foot (poundal)[39m
  [36m                            = 5 - MM: mm (milli newton)[39m
  [36m                            = 6 - CM: cm (centi newton)[39m
  [36m                            = 7 - IN: Inch (pound f)[39m
  [36m                            = 8 - GM: mm (kilogram f)[39m
  [36m                            = 9 - US: USER_DEFINED[39m
  [36m            Field 2      -- units description (used for[39m
  [36m                            documentation only)[39m
  [36m            Field 3      -- temperature mode[39m
  [36m                            = 1 - absolute[39m
  [36m                            = 2 - relative[39m
  
  [36mRecord 2: FORMAT(3D25.17)[39m
  [36m            Unit factors for converting universal file units to SI.[39m
  [36m            To convert from universal file units to SI divide by[39m
  [36m            the appropriate factor listed below.[39m
  [36m            Field 1      -- length[39m
  [36m            Field 2      -- force[39m
  [36m            Field 3      -- temperature[39m
  [36m            Field 4      -- temperature offset[39m
data.text/markdown:
Universal Dataset Number: 164

**Name:   Units**

```julia
Record 1: FORMAT(I10,20A1,I10)
            Field 1      -- units code
                            = 1 - SI: Meter (newton)
                            = 2 - BG: Foot (pound f)
                            = 3 - MG: Meter (kilogram f)
                            = 4 - BA: Foot (poundal)
                            = 5 - MM: mm (milli newton)
                            = 6 - CM: cm (centi newton)
                            = 7 - IN: Inch (pound f)
                            = 8 - GM: mm (kilogram f)
                            = 9 - US: USER_DEFINED
            Field 2      -- units description (used for
                            documentation only)
            Field 3      -- temperature mode
                            = 1 - absolute
                            = 2 - relative

Record 2: FORMAT(3D25.17)
            Unit factors for converting universal file units to SI.
            To convert from universal file units to SI divide by
            the appropriate factor listed below.
            Field 1      -- length
            Field 2      -- force
            Field 3      -- temperature
            Field 4      -- temperature offset
```

data.text/latex:
Universal Dataset Number: 164

\textbf{Name:   Units}

\begin{verbatim}
Record 1: FORMAT(I10,20A1,I10)
            Field 1      -- units code
                            = 1 - SI: Meter (newton)
                            = 2 - BG: Foot (pound f)
                            = 3 - MG: Meter (kilogram f)
                            = 4 - BA: Foot (poundal)
                            = 5 - MM: mm (milli newton)
                            = 6 - CM: cm (centi newton)
                            = 7 - IN: Inch (pound f)
                            = 8 - GM: mm (kilogram f)
                            = 9 - US: USER_DEFINED
            Field 2      -- units description (used for
                            documentation only)
            Field 3      -- temperature mode
                            = 1 - absolute
                            = 2 - relative

Record 2: FORMAT(3D25.17)
            Unit factors for converting universal file units to SI.
            To convert from universal file units to SI divide by
            the appropriate factor listed below.
            Field 1      -- length
            Field 2      -- force
            Field 3      -- temperature
            Field 4      -- temperature offset
\end{verbatim}

data.text/plain:
[36mDataset164[39m

  A struct containing UFF Dataset 164 metadata.

  [1mFields[22m

    [34m• [39m [36mtype::Symbol[39m: Data set type
    [34m• [39m [36munits::Int[39m: Units code
    [34m• [39m [36mdescription::String[39m: Units description
    [34m• [39m [36mtemperature_mode::Int[39m: Temperature mode
    [34m• [39m [36mconversion_factor::Vector{Float64}[39m: Units factors for converting
       to SI units
data.text/markdown:
```julia
Dataset164
```

A struct containing UFF Dataset 164 metadata.

**Fields**

  * `type::Symbol`: Data set type
  * `units::Int`: Units code
  * `description::String`: Units description
  * `temperature_mode::Int`: Temperature mode
  * `conversion_factor::Vector{Float64}`: Units factors for converting to SI units
data.text/html:
Dataset164

A struct containing UFF Dataset 164 metadata.

Fields

  • type::Symbol: Data set type

  • units::Int: Units code

  • description::String: Units description

  • temperature_mode::Int: Temperature mode

  • conversion_factor::Vector{Float64}: Units factors for converting to SI units
